name: Alto Flute
shortDescription: A type of flute pitched in the key of G

name: Alto Saxophone
shortDescription: A member of the saxophone family of woodwind instruments

name: Baritone Saxophone
shortDescription: A member of the saxophone family of woodwind instruments

name: Bass Clarinet
shortDescription: A member of the clarinet family of woodwind instruments

name: Bass Clarinet in Bb
shortDescription: A member of the clarinet family of woodwind instruments

name: Bass Flute
shortDescription: A type of flute pitched one octave below the concert flute

name: Bass Saxophone
shortDescription: A member of the saxophone family of woodwind instruments

name: Bass Trombone
shortDescription: A member of the trombone family of brass instruments

name: Bass Trombone with F Attachment
shortDescription: A type of bass trombone with an additional valve

name: Bass Trumpet
shortDescription: A type of trumpet pitched one octave below the standard Bb trumpet

name: Bass Viola da Gamba
shortDescription: A stringed instrument with frets, played with a bow

name: Bassoon
shortDescription: A woodwind instrument with a double reed, played with both hands and the lips

name: Bells
shortDescription: A percussion instrument consisting of a set of metal bars of varying lengths, struck with mallets

name: Celesta
shortDescription: A keyboard instrument with metal plates struck by hammers, producing a bell-like sound

name: Cello
shortDescription: A large stringed instrument played with a bow, held between the legs

name: Clarinet in Bb
shortDescription: A woodwind instrument with a single reed, played with both hands and the lips

name: Clarinet in Eb
shortDescription: A woodwind instrument with a single reed, played with both hands and the lips

name: Contra-Alto Clarinet
shortDescription: A low-pitched woodwind instrument with a single reed, played with both hands and the lips

name: Contrabass Clarinet
shortDescription: A very low-pitched woodwind instrument with a single reed, played with both hands and the lips

name: Contrabass Saxophone
shortDescription: A large member of the saxophone family with a rich and deep sound

name: Contrabass Tuba
shortDescription: The largest and lowest pitched instrument in the tuba family

name: Contrabassoon
shortDescription: A larger and lower pitched version of the bassoon

name: Cornet
shortDescription: A brass instrument similar to the trumpet but with a more mellow tone

name: Double Bass
shortDescription: The largest and lowest-pitched bowed string instrument in the modern symphony orchestra

name: English Horn
shortDescription: A double-reed woodwind instrument similar to the oboe but with a lower, darker tone

name: English Horn in F
shortDescription: A type of English horn that is pitched in F

name: Euphonium
shortDescription: A brass instrument that is similar to the tuba but smaller and more agile

name: Flugelhorn
shortDescription: A brass instrument similar to the trumpet but with a wider, conical bore

name: French Horn
shortDescription: A brass instrument with a distinctive sound created by its flared bell and long, coiled tubing

name: Glockenspiel
shortDescription: Percussion instrument consisting of tuned metal bars

name: Harp
shortDescription: Stringed instrument with many strings tuned to different pitches

name: Harpsichord
shortDescription: Keyboard instrument in which strings are plucked by quills

name: Heckelphone
shortDescription: Double reed woodwind instrument with a tone similar to the oboe

name: Mandolin
shortDescription: Stringed instrument with a pear-shaped body and fretted neck

name: Marimba
shortDescription: Percussion instrument consisting of wooden bars struck with mallets

name: Oboe
shortDescription: Woodwind instrument with a double reed and conical bore

name: Octobass
shortDescription: String instrument that produces very low notes

name: Ocarina
shortDescription: An ancient wind musical instrument.

name: Organ
shortDescription: A keyboard instrument that produces sound by blowing air through pipes.

name: Percussion
shortDescription: A category of musical instruments that produce sound by being struck, shaken, or scraped.

name: Piano
shortDescription: A keyboard instrument that produces sound by striking strings with hammers.

name: Piccolo
shortDescription: A small flute that plays an octave higher than the standard concert flute.

name: Sarrusophone
shortDescription: A family of brass instruments that are similar to the saxophone.

name: Serpent
shortDescription: A wind instrument that is similar to a bass cornett.

name: Snare Drum
shortDescription: A percussion instrument that has strands of wires under the drumhead that vibrate when struck.

name: Sousaphone
shortDescription: A type of tuba that is wrapped around the body and is commonly used in marching bands.

name: Soprano Saxophone
shortDescription: Woodwind instrument that plays in the soprano range.

name: Tenor Drum
shortDescription: A cylindrical drum that produces a deep sound.

name: Tenor Saxophone
shortDescription: Woodwind instrument that plays in the tenor range.

name: Theremin
shortDescription: Electronic instrument that is played without physical contact.

name: Timpani
shortDescription: Large kettle drums that are played with mallets.

name: Triangle
shortDescription: Percussion instrument that is struck with a metal beater.

name: Trombone
shortDescription: Brass instrument that uses a slide to change pitches.

name: Trumpet
shortDescription: Brass instrument played mainly in jazz and classical ensembles.

name: Tuba
range: F1 to B♭1 (contrabass tuba) or CC2 to F4 (bass tuba)
shortDescription: Large brass instrument with a deep, mellow sound.

name: Vibraphone
shortDescription: Percussion instrument with metal bars and a motor-driven rotating disk to create a vibrato effect.

name: Viola
shortDescription: String instrument that is larger than a violin and smaller than a cello.

name: Violin
shortDescription: Small string instrument played with a bow or plucked with the fingers.

name: Voice
shortDescription: Musical instrument that produces sound with the human voice.

name: Wagner Tuba
shortDescription: Valved brass instrument developed by Richard Wagner for use in his operas.

name: Xylophone
shortDescription: Percussion instrument with wooden bars that are struck with mallets to produce sound.

name: Zither
range: Depends on the type of zither
shortDescription: Stringed instrument played by plucking the strings with the fingers or a plectrum.
